references.paper_title: Regression modelling strategies for improved prognostic prediction
references.reason: This paper is foundational for survival prediction, introducing key concepts and strategies for building and evaluating prognostic models.

references.paper_title: Multivariable prognostic models: issues in developing models, evaluating assumptions and adequacy, and measuring and reducing errors
references.reason: This paper expands on Harrell's earlier work by delving deeper into the complexities of multivariable prognostic modeling, addressing issues in model development, assessment, and error reduction.

references.paper_title: Effective ways to build and evaluate individual survival distributions
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the problem of individual survival distribution estimation, providing key methods and evaluation metrics for improved survival prediction models.
This paper introduces conformalized quantile regression, a post-processing technique used in CSD-iPOT to enhance calibration properties of survival models without compromising discrimination.

references.paper_title: Conformalized survival distributions: A generic post-process to increase calibration
references.reason: This paper is directly related to the current work as it introduces a framework that enhances calibration while preserving discrimination performance in survival analysis; CSD-iPOT builds upon this framework
